summary: This bill, the "Restoring Competitive Property Insurance Availability Act," amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude certain income from gross income for insurance companies providing real property insurance in federally declared disaster areas. The exclusion applies to qualified real property insurance income during the recovery period, defined as the first five taxable years after the incident date. The bill defines key terms like "specified insurance company," "qualified real property insurance income," and "disaster area." The amendments apply to disaster areas with an incident date after December 31, 2024.
